TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Cryogenic Engines: Liquid Hydrogen and Methane Rockets! (Jan 22, 2022)

Articles.Content: Just a quick suggestion, would it be possible to add vernier engines to this pack?  I love building rockets with these engines, but the stock verniers run on <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O, so they can't be used on a stage with one of these babies, which means hauling extra mono-propellant for <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> quads.
awesome, thanks!

In regards to the surface attachment patch:

If this patch is installed, does it make the engine BOTH surface and tank-end attaching, as opposed to surface attaching only?

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, stellargeli said:
> 
> 
> If this patch is installed, does it make the engine BOTH surface and tank-end attaching, as opposed to surface attaching only?
> 

Correct, you'll be able to snap to node as well as create surface-attached clusters.

I can't start the game with Cryogenic Engines when using <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> / <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>, the loading stops after the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches were done at:

<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> question: <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> thread!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-07T21:15:37Z" title="05/07/2017 09:15  PM" data-short="7 yr">May 7, 2017</time> by Gordon Dry**

I just use this thread to thank you [@Nertea](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/83952-nertea/) for all your mods!

My first "big mod" was the near future pack way back then when I had no idea what I was actually doing. It was great.

Now I just expanded my techtree with CTT and your modpacks since I reached the end and thought it is time to come back to near future.

So now I just got all your creations and wanted to thank you, I'll never forget that friday night with my calculator planing my trip to moho with argon engines just to find out I overestimated their <abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio">TWR</abbr> - glorious times!

Cheers

Edit I looked at yll the Imgur albums and must say this one has the best descriptions. "Fwoomp", "Sizzle" ...

Okay, I added CryoEngines again and removed the RealFuel-Stockalike and RealPlume-RFStockalike configs ... my bad.  

I guess that was the issue.

Frustrating...

Just tried it out of curiosity with Near Future Construction and crashed to desktop when it tried to load the parts during game startup so I have to say no, it does not work.

Since this affects CE as well as KA, [please have a look at this post.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/130503-122-kerbal-atomics-fancy-nuclear-engines-march-2-various-fixes/&do=findComment&comment=3076308)

I'd also like to put out the call for people who use this mod and either ModularFuelTanks, ProcedualFuelTanks or ProceduralWings and are able to spend some time looking at the configs. I don't know how these mods work, and there's user-contributed patches as part of CryoTanks that have been variously reported to "not work". I need some help repairing these. If not, I'll just rip them out.

The current version of the configs are [here](https://github.com/ChrisAdderley/CryoTanks/tree/dev/GameData/CryoTanks/Patches).

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-05T23:46:21Z" title="06/05/2017 11:46  PM" data-short="7 yr">June 5, 2017</time> by Nertea**

I'm willing to bet there are bugs in this one due to the sheer amount of new content.

**Cryo Engines 0.5.0**

- KSP 1.3
- Updated <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> to 2.8.0
- Updated B9PartSwitch to 1.8.0
- Updated CRP to 0.7.1
- Updated MiniAVC to 1.0.3.3
- Setup parts to use KSP 1.3 localization
- Renamed a few engines for consistency and <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> location
- Fixed incorrect layer for most engine FX
- Changed heat animations to use Throttle method (as in Kerbal Atomics)
- Updated heat production values of engines, tied primarily to engine total power now
- Adjusted IntakeAir consumption of Cutlass engine in LH2 patch
- Significant improvements to CryoTanks package
    - Now versioned (Version 0.4.0)
    - Normalized LH2 tank mass ratios to 5 (from ~3.5), this affects all tanks containing LH2 or LH2/OX
    - Normalized naming scheme for ZBO tanks to reflect their capacities
    - Reworked tank capacities
    - Improved fuel switching patch to account for more exceptions
    - New 5m tank models (15m and 7.5m lengths)
    - Deprecated 3.75m length tank variant for 3.75m inline tanks (temporary)
    - Reworked models and textures for all fuel tanks
    - New structureless variants for all inline tanks
    - Optimized SimpleBoiloff plugin
    - Cooling functions can now be disabled in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>
    - Reduced the scope of the SimpleBoiloff plugin, most advanced functions are now part of DynamicBatteryStorage
    - New sub-plugin: DynamicBatteryStorage
        - Dynamically adjusts EC storage to combat KSP crap resource mechanics at high timewarp
        - Should dramatically reduce instances of EC loss at high timewarp

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Nertea said:
> 
> 
> **Cryo Engines 0.5.0**
> 
> 
> 
> - Changed heat animations to use Throttle method (as in Kerbal Atomics)
> 

I'm a little out of the loop these days since my computer can't run the game anymore, has this always been possible? Does it tie the throttle % to animation keys? What happens when you floor/kill the throttle?

Thanks for a great update as always, waiting until I'm able to try all this stuff out is killing me.

Just as note, there seems to be an problem in the version file, which confuses <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> for Cryo Tanks. If youre interested, you can check: [http://status.ksp-<abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>.org/](http://status.ksp-ckan.org/)  

Error is: "AVC: Invalid path to remote GameData/KerbalAtomics/Versioning/KerbalAtomics.version, doesn't match any of..."  

I don't know why it refers to Kerbal Atomic, tho

EDIT: OK, [CryoTanks Netkan](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN/blob/master/NetKAN/CryoTanks.netkan) has a hardcoded version reference to KerbalAtomics. I think that's something for the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> guys. Reported it [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/154922-ckan-the-comprehensive-kerbal-archive-network-v1223-mahia/&page=16#comment-3093417).

Hello [@Nertea](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/83952-nertea/), thanks for the update! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I just noticed in the op that there seems to be a typo that states that Cryogenic Engines are designed to work well with Cryogenic Engines.
